intro: Conostylis seorsiflora, commonly known as the narrow-leaved conostylis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. This species is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. It produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny white or pale blue flowers. Conostylis seorsiflora is typically found in sandy or rocky soils in arid or semi-arid regions.
